page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY- AUCHINLECK
page.content: The village has historical associations with the biographer James Boswell(1740 - 1795).In 1978 the Auchinleck Boswell Society restored from ruins,the old church and created the Boswell Museum.Attached to the museum is the Boswell Mausoleum,the family's burial vault. A corner of the Museum has been arranged to commemorate the work of William Murdoch(1754 - 1839),the inventor of gas lighting,who was born at Lugar,in the Parish of Auchinleck. The Museum is situated next to the Barony Church in the south east corner of the village. Within the churchyard is a memorial to Richard Cameron and other famous Covenanters.Cameron and his group were captured at Aird's Moss,N.E. of Auchinleck after publishing the Sanquhar Declaration (1680).
